But armed with clean and sanitation sectors through out the building, makes this a safe and friendly environment for those concerned of contracting an infection/virus. Treat with respect and revive respect. patience is the number one key to success. Stay safe folks. Care for one another. Until next time. Over and out.<//review>

< Text>
Went for a scheduled driving test appointment at 1pm, came at 12:15. The front desk clerk told us to stand on the red carpet. After standing there for 15 minutes with no clerk working at the window, we sat down at the chairs in front of the red carpet. Twice we went back to ask if we are at the right lane and if we need a ticket with a number. Then the same clerk went by and saw we were sitting there waiting. At 1:15 someone finally came to the window, asked a name of a person who came 40 minutes after us. We then stood and went to that red line. When we finally got to the window, the clerk told us we were late and marked us as no show.
The reason they used was we were not standing on the red carpet, so she did not see us. The manager supported it and said we could wait as a stand-by. We did not and left without being served.</Text>

Hey, it's the DMV. You know what it is like, Why are you reading a review? They are all the same. <userid>114171406251670457705</userid>< user_name>
Lash Tan</user_name>
< time>
1410630772299<//time>
<Rating>5</Rating>< Text>
As a guy who had only gone to walk-in barber shops in the past, I was fairly intimidated by trying out a hair salon.  I had only really had one simple hair style for most of my adult life and for the longest time I hadn't thought much of it.  But once I decided to change things up and grow out my hair a little bit, my barber didn't seem to have a clue what to do.  And honestly, I was a bit lost myself on what styles would fit me - I was new at this too!

After several failed attempts at finding a new hair cut (at many different barber shops, mind you) I finally gave in.  I came to Hair Concept (it was actually Hair Sanctuary the first time I came) and I'll admit I was a bit uncomfortable at first.  I was out of my comfort zone.  I think they were able to notice this because several of the stylists made sure to greet me even though they were focused on their clients.  It could have been because they had never seen me before and knew I was a new client, but everyone seemed extremely polite and welcoming.

I waited for a couple minutes before Samantha was ready for me.  I told her my history and what I was hoping to accomplish and that I could definitely use her input.  We actually discussed this for several minutes.  She would give me suggestions and I would voice my concerns.  I loved how she didn't try to push anything on me, she seemed invested to find a style that I would actually enjoy (and stick with!).  Eventually we both had a good understanding of what cut I would go with.  Samantha was very friendly.  She isn't one of those stylists that needs to fill every second with small talk, which I'm glad for.  But she is nice to talk to, which is good because I think it's important to build a relationship with your hair stylist.  As for the cut itself, I loved it!  I realized that there was no way I could have stayed at my previous barber and asked them for this cut.  I've returned to Samantha three times now and I haven't been disappointed.  Every cut I've had is consistent.  I also have her show me different ways I can apply product which is very helpful.  Overall, I'm extremely happy I found this place!!< /Text>

< text>
I've been coming here for over 5 years.  I think it is very difficult to find a hair stylist that you are both comfortable with and will listen to what you really want out of your hair.  I have been to very many places and worked with a number of hair stylist but no one gets my wants and needs like Samantha does.  She's patient and will give you her honest opinion on what will work for your hair.  The time goes by super fast also because she's very easy to talk to.

Also a huge issue with me is that my hair is really long and everytime I go somewhere else to get it trimmed, they usually do what they want and cut of more inches than I requested!  Sammi really tells me her honest opinion when I go in for a trim, but if I really want my hair to be 2-3 inches less..she will really listen to my request and cut only that.

Really though, finding a hair stylist that is easy to talk to and does great work is very rare.  I suggest you find out her next available appointment asap!  The salon is easy to find and there's a roomy lot in the back.</text>

< text>
How many times have you dined out for dinner and while eating said to those around you, "This food is really amazing, It's just incredible." If you are like me, not too many. Cafe Zack is one of those rare restaurants where that can happen and it happened to us this past Tuesday evening. What's most interesting is that Cafe Zack has been in business in Ventura for more than 25 years and it's one of those rare restaurants that started out very good and has even gotten better over the years.<//text>

<UserId.>104079418035737201312</UserId.><username>John Westwood<//username>< Date>
1553653566695< /Date>
< rating>
5<//rating>
< review>
Food was incredible. I loved every bite.
This is a very small romantic place that would be great for a date night (I say this even though I was eating alone hah).
Most of the people there had reservations, I was lucky enough to get the last table without one.
They we're out of the wild boar so I got the peppercorn encrusted filet mignon which was served with potatoes and fresh veggies. The filet was buttery the potatoes were rich the veggies we're crunchy and sweet. Yeah the meal was fantastic.
The restaurant itself felt a little bit weird since it's basically in a converted house.
Plates are priced high, but if your looking for this type of food experience it is worth it.< /review>

</dataset><record>

I had reservations for dinner with my wife for Valentine's day. I thought everything would be fine since we had a table reserved but when we arrived it was so packed there was a line out the door and no one was even checking for reservations. <Date>1562140840448<//Date><UserId.>106418754109736570095< /UserId.>< Review>
I had dinner here last night with four dear friends. Three of us were treating a lovely couple (Evan and Fran) to a thank-you dinner for hosting us refugees from fire evacuations in Oak Park and Thousand Oaks. What a treat to share a delectable meal with good friends! The restaurant's atmosphere is charming, the service divine, and the food sumptuous. I had the special lobster ravioli, and at $22, it was worth every bite. Best lobster ravioli I've had in my life. The five of us shared three desserts: two Zack's Pies and the bread budding. Not a bite left on anyone plate: salad, entrees, dessert . . . devoured. Will return!< /Review>

There were four of us that were desperately hungry late (9:00) on a Saturday evening.  We had called several restaurants and no one would serve us - in fact we were rather rudely spoken to by two places. < text>
A cozy house with a covered back porch, great ambiance, friendly staff, linen table clothes, a solid wine list,  fresh and delicious food from a menu with the perfect mix of salads, meat, fish, soup, pasta, and decadent desserts make this one of Ventura's oldest and most successful restaurants. Perfect for date night or birthday lunches, you can't go wrong with Cafe Zacks. Make you dinner reservations ahead of time, this gem fills up quickly.< /text>

< Text>
This place is the best. We have gone to Cafe Zack for two special occasions. We had great service both times. It gets busy in there but it never negatively affected our service.

The first time, I had the Halibut special, it was AMAZING. Our server told us that he thinks that they have 'the best filet mignon in the county,' so my boyfriend tried that. HE WAS NOT KIDDING, it was so good. The next time we came, we both ordered that. I was the best filet mignon I've ever had. Order it with the peppercorn sauce. You will not be disappointed!</Text>

< user_name>
Claire Buchy<//user_name>
<Response>None</Response>< rate>
3<//rate>
<pics>None< /pics>< userid>
107109437259766495818<//userid>
< Text>
It is what I called an "Internet Adventure" week end. I wanted to spend the night in Ventura to be close to our Sunday's event in Camarillo. We stayed at the Inn On The Beach, I already wrote a review on it. Cafe Zack is the second part of the adventure. According to my online research, it was one of the closest restaurant that didn't look like a steak house, a chain restaurant or a sushi place. The menu sounded nice, the ambiance romantic.
I was very disappointed. The place looks like it is in somebody's garage, which, actually, it is... I even wondered (and asked) if I came in by the right door. That was it for the romantic aspect of it... The food is OK. I cannot really complain about it. I ate everything I ordered, it was good but not great. The wine was OK too. The reason I didn't leave the place at first glance is because the staff was very nice, our waiter Alphonso was super friendly and did his very best to please us.
The Late Harvest Viognier dessert wine we got at the end of the dinner saved it all, it is a delicacy. This is the only thing I will recommend. I would not go back, certainly not but I cannot say it was a bad experience either. My partner and I made the best of it and we laughed a lot. Glad we have such great sense of humor!
I give it a 3 stars for the same reason than the hotel, it's right in the middle!<//Text>
< date>
1416242705290<//date>

<Rate>1< /Rate><Review>I just went into Pacific sleep disorder for my sleep study tonight. I was not able to sleep at all for the following reasons:

1. The memory foam mattress was too stiff.
2. The pillows were too stiff.
3. They had the air conditioner on and the cold air would continuously hit my face. My sinuses got dry and irritated and I could not breathe well. It was 40 degrees outside, I still use the heater in my house because the weather is still cold. I asked the staff to turn the air conditioner off if they could and they said they could not turn it off. They gave me a surgical face mask to help but it didn't. It felt like it was around 60 to 65 degrees in my room.  It was very uncomfortable.

The lady that helped me was very friendly though but I am still giving the establishment a 1 star because it is almost if not impossible to sleep on one of their beds unless you have not slept in days. I was not able to get diagnosed with sleep apnea meaning I am still screwed and don't get good sleep when I do sleep at home because I won't get approved for any medical treatment yet. This is so frustrating. Oh, and to make an appointment it is such a pain in the neck. The staff is not very helpful. I had to call them three times and my doctor twice just to get them to schedule me in for a sleep study. Most horrible experience.<//Review><pics>None</pics>< Response>
{'time': 1518463811300, 'text': 'Sergio, we are sorry that you had problems with your sleep testing.  We understand that when people sleep in an unfamiliar place and bed, it can be difficult to fall asleep. Our beds are memory foam and are relatively new.  We have not had any complaints about their comfort previously.  As for the temperature in your room, I am addressing this issue with our technicians and administrative staff to find out why this happened.  We will be in touch soon.  We do offer in-home testing.  Ask your doctor if he would order an in-home test, it might make you feel more comfortable and able to sleep better in order for us to get optimal results.  Anything we can do for you, please let us know.  Thank you for your comments and honesty.  We strive to be the best we can be and take these comments very seriously.'}< /Response>

</dataset><record>
<gmap_id>0x808fc9a561449e39:0xc0377e1f3ff54e1d</gmap_id><Text>We have been living here for nearly 2 years.
Pros:
Pretty landscaping and pool area. Quiet and safe. 10 min walk to Safeway and Guadalupe Trail is right across the road with a nature reserve and park next door.
The maintenance crew are always responsive and pleasant.
Cons:
Since the new management took over last year we have had numerous requests of contractors to enter on the wrong dates or the letter comes after they’ve already entered without our knowledge. Our bikes have gone missing and no one responds to our emails, each time we go to the office on the weekend, as it is only open on the weekdays from 9-5, it is always unattended with their return always over an hour later. Their automated rental payment system doesn’t allow for the varying invoice amount to include the monthly water bill so we have to pay it manually. If you are 3 days late, you get an eviction threat posted on your door, an email would suffice considering we’d never missed a payment in over 18 months.

First of all i want to explain that in order for me to write a review, the service/product needs to be exceptional or below average. In this case the service was exceptional. Above and beyond. Was in the process of moving to a new location with only a few days left in my schedule to decide and Jenly Lam, exceeded my expectations. This was my 18th property i viewed in 5 days so you can imagine the stress/anxiety. Need to move in now but don't want to settle. None of the previous 17 Leasing Consultants knew about the units as well as Jenly Lam did. When you're moving, the process is very stressful. I explained what I needed in the unit including a view since i was scheduled to work from home all day ever day. Jenly Lam was the only consultant that was excited about the unit as i was because she understood what i was looking for. She saw my vision. The previous 17 lease consultants had very little energy, just going through the motions. This position is a sales position. Therefore should be treated as such. Understand what the client is looking for and find either the right unit or something close to it. Tell them why it would fit their needs. Why would a potential tenant move into your complex opposed to 1000s of other units with similar amenities and? It's their attention to detail. When i left the viewing, I had 5 other properties to view but after driving out the driveway, i realized Nantucket was the ideal complex with the perfect unit i needed.  I immediately drove right back and started the process. Jenly helped me every step of the approval process, communicated effectively and got me approved in less than 24 hours!!!!!   I do have to mention that if it wasn't for Jenly, I would not have moved here. The other consultants are ok but they're a dime a dozen including the other consultants at Nantucket. Wasn't sure if i was calling the leasing office or the doctor's office. I had to do a double take. <date>1578094169053<//date><Rate>4<//Rate>< text>
Lived here during 2019. Overall a pleasant experience--moved for need of elevators. Would have strongly considered staying otherwise.

- Location: 5/5. Situated right next to Lick Mill Park, which is a nice place to go on walks. Close enough to the VTA station for commuting. Close to Safeway and Target.
- Building Features: 4/5. Good overall. Does not have elevators for those living above first floor. Most units are all-carpet.
- Maintenance: 4/5. Building is kept clean-looking. Leaves on sidewalk are regularly cleared. Trash collection area is regularly emptied, but there were a couple of instances when they looked overfilled.
- Amenties: 4/5. Pool with Spa, Two grills in pool area side by side, Gym, Game Room with Pool Table. Couldn't figure out how to get access to the Game Room after locks were replaced with app-based access. Package Locker feature is available as an option.
- Management: 5/5. Every communication with management was pleasant. Maintenance staff is one of the friendliest I've ever experienced.<//text>

I have been living here for the past couple of years and all set to live for the next year as well. I have been to other apartments in the neighborhood but Nantucket stands out among all of them. Anthony is always ready to help for any maintenance issue. I am totally impressed by these two folks.
To the readers, do visit the apartment, I am sure you will be pleasantly surprised.<//Text>

<user_id>113475945755546265539<//user_id><Name>Ava Miller</Name>< Time>
1512937315989< /Time>
<rating>1< /rating><review>I've never had an apartment complex work so hard at making me feel less at home. The management is clearly more concerned with gaining new residents than maintaining their current ones. The leasing office was so nice and responsive when I was looking at the apartment, but all that changed once I moved in. The women who work at the front desk are some of the rudest and most unpleasant people with whom I've ever had the misfortune of dealing. Every time I walked into the office, one of them would just look at me and say "what do you need?" No smile, no "how are you?," no pleasantries at all. They were even rude to my guests who came to visit. Often, there wouldn't even be anybody in the office, and one time, my boyfriend, who had just driven 5 hours from LA, had to wait for almost two hours for someone to get him the key I had left at the desk. When the lady finally came back from "lunch," she ended up calling me at work to yell at me because I had sent a message about the key to the main office email address instead of her address even though I had spoken to her about the key in person earlier that morning and had left it in an envelope with all the information written on it.

On top of that, there was an "annual inspection" or some other excuse for them to enter everyone's apartments at least once a month. During these "inspections," they would make you clean out the storage closet on your balcony and remove your pets from your unit. Several times after I had already made these arrangements for the day, I would come home to a notice that they had to reschedule for some reason. I also came home one day to find my living room furniture completely rearranged because they had to move something onto the balcony without giving me prior warning and didn't even have the decency to leave my apartment the way they had found it.

The apartments themselves are nice enough, but the equipment in the gym is old and constantly breaking and the pool is never clean. There were also several incidents of people's cars being broken into while I was there. The gate to enter the complex also blew down on a windy day, so I'm not sure what that says about the security system.

When my tenancy in hell was finally coming to an end because I was moving to a new city, I tried to work with the front office in scheduling my move out date, but they were completely unreasonable. They said they would charge me a $500 fee plus the prorated amount if I stayed even one day past the date my lease ended. I've lived in many apartments over the years, and they all were very willing to work with me on my move out date and charge a reasonable amount for any time spent past the lease end-date. I guess I shouldn't have been surprised given the way I had been treated over the year at Nantucket.

Overall, if you're going to spend the amount of money these apartments cost, you're better off finding a place where the management treats residents with common decency and respect, and somewhere you can actually come to call "home."< /review><Pics>None<//Pics>< response>
{'time': 1513281014796, 'text': "Hello Ava,\n\nWe sincerely apologize that your experience isn't what you feel it should be. <Review>This is ABSOLUTELY NOT A SECURE PLACE TO LIVE!

My friend's car got broken into DURING THE DAY in the parking lots of the apartment! Please see the picture in the gallery.

Three issues with security:

1. The two gates closes so slowly that any car can tailgate a authorized car and sneak into the community.

2. I have talked to several guys who lived here for more than 3 years and they said the gates won't close now and then. I just moved into the apartment for one month and I have already seen this happened and the gate didn't get repaired for 3 days, now it's still open:-( That means any burglar can enter into the community easily.

3. There's no security camera inside the community, even the two gates don't have security cameras right in front of them, which means if any burglary happens no useful info will be provided to the police, and the burglars will probably come back again.

To the ones who plan to move in:

You will pay a crazy amount of money for the monthly payment, and you don't even get enough security for your home and your car? What the hell is that? < UserId.>
107934879721300717348< /UserId.>
< user_name>
Landon Edmond<//user_name>
< Date>
1603145670645</Date>
< Rating>
5< /Rating>
< Review>
They say you measure service with how you perform when no one is looking.  I will take that further and say, you measure service when you are not at the register buying..  I have been buying tires exclusively for all of my cars over the years at Big O San Ramon based on their great service, integrity and pricing.  This past week I got a flat on the Grapevine headed to LA.   Not ideal but even less than ideal with a sports suv and a 22” wheel.  As we were stuck trying to find a new tire with no luck, it came to mind to call Chris in San Ramon.  Not only did he pick up, but he gave us advice on a temporary solution to get us to LA and then advice on getting new tires while in LA.  Our trip was salvaged and were are back home safely.  Needless to say, I will continue buying tires and using Big O San Ramon exclusively(as possible) :).  Thank you Chris and Big O San Ramon!</Review>

< Name>
Samantha Iufer<//Name>
< Text>
Getting my car serviced at Big O was one of the best experiences I've had with my car. I had my car at Costco across the street getting a tire fixed (since it was under warranty there) and they had an issue getting the lug nuts off. Costco said Big O could fix the lug nut issue, and then I could bring my car back to to replace the tire. I had meetings all day long and could not leave work (down the road at Bishop Ranch) - so I prayed and called Big O asking if they wouldn't mind getting my car from Costco, fixing the lug nuts, and then returning it to Costco. I was not an existing customer, and they ended up doing this for me all over the phone. Best service ever and they saved the day for me. I had a razor in my tire and HAD to get it fixed before I drove home - but was unable to leave work early. The guys here were the nicest and were super honest. I ended up getting my next oil change with them as a thank you for the extra mile they went for my tires, and that went just as smooth. I'd recommend them to anyone looking for that local, honest car mechanic. :) They seriously saved my butt!< /Text>

<user>112496232473491621014</user>< user_name>

< time>
1549389445036< /time>
<rating>5</rating>< Review>
I originally thought Big O were for offroad trucks n such... good thing I finally made the plunge and went in.

First I brought in my wife's vehicle for full brake rotors and pad swap with new brake fluid. Significantly cheaper than the dealership while utilizing the same OEM parts.

Next, I brought in my vehicle for a nail in the tire.Done professionally, done right.

Thx Big O!👌<//Review>

<GmapID>0x80dd29b031f0f5ab:0xb3c7ed13a4feff91</GmapID><time>1499736690764<//time><user>111735582005377286424</user>< Text>
They have a large selection of games for game consoles at fair prices. No PC games.
My main gripe was when we entered the man said hello, but after 15 to 20 minutes, he had not made an effort to ask us if we needed help. My friend picked a game and he didn't even bother to ask us if we were ready to go. I made eye contact with the man, and he lowered his eyes. I had to initiate conversation with this man to get my questions answered, instead of him using his customer service to help a paying customer.

Also there was no music which was mildly umcomfortable.

Updating my review because they gave my friend the wrong disk for the game he purchased, when he went back they gave him another game to go with it as an apology. That was awesome of them.</Text>

<text>Having been to other used game stores and big bog stores for my gaming needs, I continued my search... Then I ran into Video Game Geeks..
A small, independent gaming store in the heart of Anaheim. I'm glad I found these guys because the place is clean, the staff is knowledgeable (and doesn't consist of neck beard nerds that will only argue or scoff at your purchases).

New games tend to be cheaper than chain stores and used/retro games come at a fair margin less than other stores around the neighborhood. My fave store...
Highly Recommended!</text><time>1367613245072<//time><UserId.>107574576659000352293< /UserId.>< username>

< text>
Great place to work, great place to eat, great place to hangout.

Saturdays and Sundays are very busy, but if you're willing to venture out on the same day as everyone else and enjoy the company of whoever you're with... well let me tell you this is the place to be! Friendly service, friendly waitstaff, outstanding work ethic. Given these rough times and the younger generation not wanting to work, you will not find another local business with employees working harder than this restaurant.

Family owned, family oriented, family friendly place!</text>

<review>Old Town Cafe is even better than Sandy's! I come here all the time for lunch and breakfast. The outdoor is seating is very good, you can't beat sitting on Pollasky Ave in the morning. Their menu is simple, but perfect. Not an overwhelming menu. There are a couple items I would change (the breakfast burrito). Lunch is very good too. I always get either a Burger or the Philly Cheese Steak. The waitstaff is pretty good. There have been a few times I have gone and the waitress was rude, the rest of the waitstaff is very good and professional.  Overall, very good.</review></record></dataset><record>

<UserId.>108195772639454321719< /UserId.><rating>5<//rating>< Date>
1539413155897< /Date>
< Text>
Last month I was experiencing some tooth pain. I needed to see someone right away and because I recently moved to Southern California I did not have a dentist. I called a few recommendations but was unable to get someone to see me right away. I decided to google dentist near me and I found Dr. Marganian. I immediately called his office and a sweet lady answered. I asked to be seen that evening and to my surprise I was given an appointment for 5:30 on that evening. When I arrived I was immediately acknowledged by the front desk staff with a smile and a warm welcome. First impressions are always lasting impressions. I was given the paperwork to complete and without having to wait a long time Sevanna the dental assistant greeted me with warmth and invited me into the exam room. A few minutes later Dr. Marganian came in with his cheerful disposition and totally put me at ease. I was nervous because back in New York I went to the same dentist for many years and didn’t know what to expect. Both Sevanna and Dr. Marganian took such good care of me that I looked forward to my follow up appointments. Joe the dental hygienist is also amazing. The office is clean, inviting and best of all has an amazing staff. If you’re stuck in a rut like I was just give this office a call and you will be sure to have found a lifelong dentist. Thank you Dr. Marganian and staff.< /Text>

<Text>This is my first time doing business with Tricon. So far everything has gone smoothly. The application/approval process was fast and the website is pretty user friendly. My point of contact,  Brian Holzwarth, was great! He always responded in a timely fashion, and answered my questions before and after my big move. My move in date was pushed out due to unforeseen circumstances, but I ended up with a brand new kitchen :-) Brian kept me updated throughout the process. The house was painted, inside and out, clean, and everything in working order. My only complaint is the “Smart Home” feature. The interface lacks everything offered by smart devices. I would have declined this option if I knew how bad it was. I’m reaching out to find out if I can get out of paying the extra $17/month for this useless “feature”

Most obvious issue with “Smart Home”  (Thermostat and Lock) is you have to go to the Tricon website, log in, and wait for the page to load, then select which device you’d like to control, and wait for that to load before anything can be done.

Thermostat -
Pros:
1. The interface allows u to raise and lower the temperature.

Cons:
1. It can’t be voice controlled by Google home or Alexa
2. It isn’t programmable
3. There is no option for alerts of temp changes
4. There is no app to quickly make changes

Door lock -
Pros:
1. You can lock and unlock the door

Cons:
1. It can’t be voice controlled by Google home or Alexa
2. I don’t get alerts on who unlocks the door
3. No tamper alarm
4. No option to auto lock
5. There is no app to quickly make changes<//Text><pictures>None< /pictures><response>{'time': 1620180241858, 'text': 'Hello Janel Drayton, thank you; we appreciate your feedback!'}< /response><GmapID>0x80dcdeebf76d28e7:0xd40e54b6d26af133<//GmapID></record>

< review>
Tricon Residential has some peculiar business practices. They denied my application to a unit on the basis that our income was slightly lower than the standard income they require for the unit. As I was speaking with the application specialist, I asked him/her if I would qualify if I offered to pay the entire lease up front from my savings. He/She said that I still wouldn't qualify!! It is completely absurd that a landlord would not accept the entire lease up front and I couldn't believe it. They did not give me a good reason for income requirement, I just assume that it is to make sure I can keep up with the payments but if I pay the lease up front then who cares! They still get their money. I am upset that I lost $100 in application fee costs for being denied based on this preposterous reason. If I could put a 0/5 stars I would but I will settle for 1/5 stars review for pure ridiculousness. I was not treated unkindly nor unprofessionally. They were actually fairly nice to me. I would like to do business with them if they give up some of their silly business principles.< /review>
<rating>1</rating><gmap_id>0x80dcdeebf76d28e7:0xd40e54b6d26af133</gmap_id>< Name>
Christopher Martin<//Name>
< user>
117329462438014262775<//user>
< Pics>
None</Pics>
<response>{'time': 1620181399794, 'text': "Christopher Martin, we are sorry to hear that you are not satisfied with the application process here at Tricon Residential. At Tricon Residential, in order to treat everyone equitably and stay in compliance with Fair Housing and Equal Opportunity laws, we utilize a third-party credit rating agency. The agency objectively qualifies all applicants to rent our homes. Each applicant's privacy and personal information is completely confidential.  As part of this confidentiality, we would never discuss contributing factors to our decision on such a public forum such as this.  However, as stated in our terms of agreement that was signed when submitting the application, the items considered for rental qualifications include criminal history, previous evictions, bankruptcy, landlord collections, utility delinquencies, FICO score, rent-to-income ratio, civil court history, level of collections, charge-offs length of rental history, and late payments.  Beyond the landlord collections, we look at your credit history, the quality and quantity of your credit.  While you did not meet our rental qualifications, we thank you for considering Tricon Residential in your rental search and wish you the best in all future endeavors."}<//response></record>
</dataset><record>

<Name>Reagan Ulmer< /Name>< review>
The physical location in my state is listed as "Permanently Closed" but the website still exists. It only has a single contact number, which I've tried calling. (Same name, messaging system, and website look as this location.) The first time I waited on hold for a person and got hung up on. The second time I left a number to call me back at. They actually did call me back, and I asked to speak with the person who had emailed me asking for a move-in date so they could send the lease because that person has not responded back after a full day and two emails. I was put on hold, waited two or three minutes and then I got hung up on again.

EDIT: I got a call back from someone in my area and they explained that the location thing is to get all the reviews in one place. The messaging system is the same because every call is going through the one place right now, while they make system changes. Said system work is making calls drop or something. They got me the majority of my lease information before they called me and the rest right after. Super happy with the agent I spoke to.

I think it would help if Tricon could at least put a note on the site about maintenance on the phone system to reassure others that they're aware of possible difficulties with contact and it's being addressed. Also please find something besides the incredibly disconcerting closing of locations to do that still gets all the reviews where they need to be to get a single score. My suggestion if there isn't another option with Google would be to re-open the local places and instead have the numbers get reported up to the home office to be averaged or something similar.

I cannot figure out how to delete the review and I don't want to leave a bad one. I'm really hoping that my problems were just a bad first impression, and I'll update again after more data points. (Original 1 averaged with the 5 star response gets a 3.)<//review>

<user_id>112516051496373540667<//user_id><date>1619836017131< /date>< text>
Our experience started really positive with Tricon Residential until it was time for us to move out. We were fortunate enough to close on our own home and needed to break the lease. After consulting with their representative as to the amount owed and an agreed upon date for the end of our lease we moved forward with breaking the lease. We slowly moved our things into our new home, due to me being pregnant and my husband working odd hours, that is what worked best for us. Without a phone call/email/etc., on the last day we had set to move our things, we arrive to a home that has been rummaged through (by Tricon staff - and we know this because they also changed the locks). They STOLE our valuables (a brand new adult bicycle, my toddler’s ride on suv, our mini fridge - left to me by my now deceased mother, as well as my personal suitcase and all that was inside of it and my husband’s weights). He (my husband)was there to collect those final things and they’ve been stolen by Tricon Residential. I can go on about how the house fell apart once we moved inside, or how they send very poorly skilled contractors to put bandaids on larger problems in their residences, a resident in which we paid $1600 monthly; however I think the fact that they stole from their residents’ is more than enough for you to avoid this company. The branch we dealt with is located in Atlanta, Ga.</text>

<Pics>None< /Pics>< review>
I'm sure it depends on each individual property and city, but we have been in our home for over a year and have just signed another extended lease. I find their prices to be fair and their people to be so wonderful. During this pandemic they have not only offered us help themselves but they have also allowed tenets to ask for outside help and they have accepted those funds and timeline as well. Our home is beautiful and the maintenance requests have always been filled in a timely manner. (Even if they don't have people available, they hire out a third-party if it's necessary) I have even been able to get my fence redone without any fight!! Communication is good. They do get very busy sometimes over the phone but they have a "call back" option and it works wonderfully. I also have my property managers direct email address so we are able to communication on payment issues or updates about the house.

I've been through some terrible rental companies and property managers and I am very very pleased with this staff and company. I was nervous at first since they are so big of a company, but I haven't felt like they have too much on their plate or they are too busy for us.<//review>

< Text>
When it was time to move in, they are responsive. When you need to break your lease to move, they will avoid your calls and continue charging rent to your account until your balance is finally in the thousands of dollars whether you are still living there or not. I was not able to reach a property manager for over 40 days... only getting a response when I started writing negative messages on social media. They will nickel and dime you on your way out to try to take advantage of you, even if you were a perfect resident. Run for your life , DO NOT RENT FROM TRICON unless you want to be involved in a legal battle upon move out. Even their own employees at the lower level told me it’s what they do. My own maintenance person assigned to our home was not even sure how to reach a property manager. Just so this review isn’t taken lightly, I’d like to state that I am a renter of 15+ years with zero issues of any kind with any other leasing agencies or landlords. My wife and I are financially competent individuals with combined college educations that would rival anyone who considers themselves a scholar. I’m not saying everyone who rents from Tricon shared our experience, but if there’s even a chance that you might, do you really want to roll those dice? There are lots of other options out there, don’t gamble with these people.<//Text>

< review>
I was at first thrown off at the cost to view, but then I respected the $1.99 fee as the process was definitely smooth and fast.  I like that no one lived in the home and all maintenance was made prior to the viewing.  Properties were very well presented.  My only down fall was that the floor plan showing the dimensions was overstated when it came to the closets.  I waited for a particular house to be ready to view because one of the bedrooms had an "overside" closet, almost as big as the masters. When I got there to view the place I walked in and said this is it. Loved the   bottom floor and knew I would love the rest until I seen that it was a LIE.  This happened at another one of there properties. I went just to check.  The closet wasnt even normal but a coat closet labeled as oversided and never in the pictures. I was totaly disappointed and set back to find a place sizable for my family. Other than that I had loved the home and just wish ads advertised as it is as I still would have viewed the home maybe not stop looking and would not have been disappointed!</review>

0x80dcdeebf76d28e7:0xd40e54b6d26af133< /gmap_id>
<rating>4</rating>< Date>
1615837551672< /Date>
< Text>
I’ve been renting with Tricon since 2018. I moved into my second home still renting through them December 2020. The reason I decided to stay renting with them instead of going somewhere else was one because they are first come first serves bias. Which is what drove me to them in 2018 to begin with. They don’t take your money and everyone else’s looking at the same home like a lot of these renting agencies and then choose which person they want to go with. Instead, if you and another family is looking at the same home, they only allow one person to pay. If the family doesn’t meet the requirements then they will alert you to finish the application process (which will be the payment of the application fees).

The next thing I appreciate about Tricon is working with Latoshia Bates. My husband was involved in a gunshot accident in August 2020 and it left him paralyzed from the waist down. I was already out of a job due to COVID-19 and now he was too. Instead of not letting us transfer to another one of their properties (due to having to have a more wheelchair accessible home) they did with no problem and didn’t penalize us for not working. Latoshia Bates helped with  the entire transfer process as much and best as she could and I want to thank them for her and the company as a whole. I gave a 4 because when it came to speaking to others in the company the timing on getting back to me was not as prompt. However, Ms. Bates was very good at getting back to me and helping solve or deescalate any problems that came my way🤗‼️ They also will work with the family during COVID-19 issues as well.

Overall, I definitely would recommend this company to anyone who is looking to rent. I’ve actually recommended my uncle, and my brother in law and his wife.  The only down side is that they do not give out rewards for recommendations.<//Text>

<name>Pamela Manigault< /name>< Time>
1609253220510</Time>
<rate>1</rate>< Text>
RENTERS BEWARE! I only wish that I had read the reviews before even considering renting from Tricon American Homes.  I have been here two weeks and this has been two weeks from hell.  First, I had to pay fees to hold the house and for a background check before I could view the home.  If I didn’t like the home after viewing  it, I would lose the money I paid in fees.  If I saw another house of interest, I would have to pay another holding fee and for another background check.  You pay these fees for every home you’re interested in.  I’ve lost close to a $1,000 before moving into the house I’m now.  Anyway, the third house that I paid a holding fee and background fee check on I had to move into because I couldn’t afford to lose any more money.  I also had to pay the deposit and first month’s rent before even being able to view this home.  Did I mention all the money paid was non refundable?  I am paying $1,595 per month, plus a mandatory Smart Home fee.  I am paying more than $700 than  this house is worth.  First, the house was filthy when I moved in.  The fireplace was dirty.  The cabinets were dirty and had food remnants in them.  The floors were dirty.  The basement had huge dead bugs and rodent droppings. I mean huge! I don’t even want to go down there.  It appeared that the previous tenants did wood work in the basement and there is saw dust everywhere.  No one bothered to clean it.  The walls (water stains?) and floors are filthy and there is a huge hole in the wall of the basement.  The basement door doesn’t close properly.  Someone can push the door and live in the basement without my daughter and I even knowing.  The house was not move-in ready like I promised it would be.  The house is a dump, uninhabitable, and unsafe.  The roof and flooring  have significant damage.  There are some places that leaks.  They covered holes in the floor with carpeting.  My daughter and I have injured ourselves by stepping in those holes and/or tripping on uneven flooring.  Electrical outlets are not secured to the wall.  The light fixture in the second bathroom is not secure and looks as if it’s about to fall any minute.  The wall in my daughter’s bedroom was not properly painted.  The vents are not secured to the wall.  Blinds are broken.  Some windows can’t open, which is terrible because the house had a horrible odor when we moved in.  Ventilation is poor.  The windows are drafty.  We hear, what we believe, are rodents in the ceiling.  According to the Smart Home App, the kitchen sink was leaking prior to me moving in and it’s still leaking.  Did they even bother to try to fix it?  They yard was not cleaned.   Screens were removed from the windows and thrown  in the ground where they remain to this day.  Not all windows have screens and the ones that do are not in good condition.  The exterior of the house is filthy.  The driveway is in horrible condition.  I fell in the driveway because I tripped over a crack. My right shoulder, arm, and hip are still hurting and the fall was two weeks ago.  I can post pictures if you don’t believe me about the condition of the house.  I don’t know what the next steps should be because Tricon should not be allowed to get away with this.  I would leave, but I don’t know where I would go.  My daughter and I left a horrible living situation and because of the instability we had for the last four years, I wanted to find a home where she would  not have to change schools.  I wanted her to have as much consistency as possible.  However, we are now in an environment that is unsafe for a different reason.< /Text>

{'time': 1607448194708, 'text': 'Pamela, we are sorry to hear about your disappointing experience with Tricon American Homes. We provide perspective residents with the option to view a home should they wish prior to applying if the home is move-in ready. In some cases, properties are undergoing the maintenance process and touring is unfortunately not available at that point in time. We provide perspective residents with the option to apply for the home if they wish to reserve the property or to wait until the home is ready for viewing before beginning the application process. We are transparent with our fees, which are $49.99 per applicant over the age of 18 and $250 for the holding fee. As listed in our Terms of Agreement if you are approved and moved in, the $250 will be applied to your first month’s rent. If you are approved and do not move in, you will forfeit the $250. If you are denied, you will be refunded the $250. If you are approved and decide to transfer your application to another home, you will forfeit the $250. We initially approved you for a home and were advised 3 weeks later that you wanted to transfer your application to another home, at this time we transferred your application and all fees, including the $250 holding fee that should have been forfeited to the new home. Once this transfer was complete, we were once again advised that you wished to transfer the application to another home. Unfortunately, as this was the second transfer your holding fee was forfeited and we required a new holding fee be paid, which we credited towards the first months rent once you executed your lease. We have confirmed that a member of our maintenance team has reached out to you directly to address all maintenance issues. Our sincerest apologies that your home was not up to Tricon’s standards at the time of your move-in. We will continue to work together on this issue to ensure all is resolved. We appreciate your residency and allowing us an opportunity to work together offline.'}< /Response>

<UserId.>111687977391722629300</UserId.>< user_name>
Ashley Mcclellan</user_name>
< Time>
1588430748512< /Time>
< rate>
2</rate>
< Text>
I’ve been currently renting from them for about two years now and I would say it’s not best but it’s also not the worst. When it comes to maintenance issues I have to say that is their upside because every time I have had an issue they have always gone above and beyond to fix the problem. However, I spend over $1500 a month in rent alone and I don’t have a dishwasher, and I also have no storage space what so ever not even a linen closet. I have to keep my vacuum in my closet with my clothing along with the mop and my towels which is not very sanitary. Same with the washer and dryer space there is not even a shelving unit to put soap or anything I just leave it on top of my dryer. The bathroom vanity is small and can only fit soap and toothbrush holder. Every year they have increased my rent which is expected but this past year was a leap year and they charged me an extra day for the leap year and prorated an extra day which is fine but extremely petty if you ask me after always paying on time. I also was paying over $300 a month for my power bill for a long time until called about my ac unit and they came out realized half the house needed to be re-insulated and the coil to be cleaned. Which after they have done has decreased dramatically since however I wish I called before. All in all it’s not terrible but not amazing. If the rent was cheaper I probably wouldn’t complain but for over $1500 and every increase, some storage space would be nice. I would adjust my review to five stars if they even came out to just add some shelves just for the laundry room or somewhere to put my towels even.<//Text>

None< /Pics>

<Text>The absolute worst experience I have had with a property management company.  My family and I moved into our home on November 1st, 2018.  Five days later, after a day of rain, our entire garage and lower bedroom flooded.  It started as an unfortunate event to bad maintenance coordination and outright negligence.  We have had contractors in and out of the house for months.  My wife and I have taken plenty of days off of work for maintenance people to access the home.  We have had thousands of dollars in damages, and were advised by our renter’s insurance company that because the flooding was due to the property managements neglect to fix the homes foundation issues prior to us moving in, we don’t have a legitimate claim.   Sometimes it would take a week before contractors would come to extract water from the caret.  We complained about a rotten mold smell emanating from the downstairs into the rest of the house.  Advised them that we have children and everyone has had breathing issues since the 3rd flooding.  Tricon eventually sent out their mold tester who advised us, because he was contracted from Tricon, he can’t tell us anything.  We have not been able to use the bedroom since moving in but still are expected to pay for the home in its entirety.  When I requested some form of proration on the rent, the property manager made a one-time concession of $600 as long as we sign their paperwork…we refused.  We have not heard back from them since.  I have called and left messages for weeks and no one has reached out to us.  We are now in the middle of May, we continue to get flooding after heavy rain and do not see an end to this matter.< /Text>< Pictures>

<name>Renee De La Rosa< /name><Date>1605048234163<//Date><rate>5</rate>< Review>
I just wanted to share an experience that I have encountered with Bridget Jones! I've been renting with Tricon for many years. Phone calls have always been short and to the point. This phone call wasn't though! This year like most families it really hit me hard. I lost my job due to Covid-19, i went through a tough divorce, my 3 children and I all tested positive for COVID so we had to quarantine and deal with all having different symptoms some worse than others and top it off the most hurtful thing in the world I lost my father (a sudden death due to COVID-19) all while we were supposed to be happy and celebrating because my oldest daughter was graduating high school and leaving to the Marines!!! I've never wanted to give up on life so much like I did when This all happened!!! I didn't know how I was going to support my kids or even continue living life without my father!!! One day I reached out to Tricon and Bridget Jones answered my phone call to ask her what my options were and to let her know that I'm trying everything I could to pay my rent! I just didn't want to lose our home!!! She not only answered my questions but she actually showed that she cared and was literally the ears that I needed to listen before I was about to go crazy!!! I'm not sure if she was busy that day or what but she made me feel like all her attention was on me. I've never met this women or talked to her a day in my life but she really really really saved me that day! She was able to help me and she went even above and beyond to check on my children and I after that phone call to see if we were ok and even sent a card to just let us know she was thinking of us Through this difficult time!!!! Even though we still aren't back on our feet she gave me hope to keep my head up and keep
Pushing through this rough year!  I will never be able To repay for her for her kind heart ❤️ Thank you so much Bridget Jones!!!!</Review>

< review>
I too have had a great 5 year experience with Tricon American Homes.

The only thing I can ask to be improved is the rent payment portal.
If I own $16.00. (above the rent amount) and have my rent paid automatically through my bank. I am unable to make a partial payment at any given time throughout the month.

The portal currently requires me to pay my rent total as well as the $16.00. (But then on the first of the month my rent would be automatically paid by my bank, causing a double rent payment and if I stop the payment through my bank, I am subject to be penalized by an additional fee. or not being allowed for a full year to pay automatically.)

There is a very small window in which I can make the $16.00 payment with out having to also pay the amount of my rent.

This has happened to me. It was frustrating, but Lydia Cole was a great help assisting me to navigate this bump in the process, but it did take a full year.

Happy Holidays Tricon American homes.<//review>

Angela Garrett< /Name>
< Date>
1562026102239< /Date>
< Rate>
4</Rate>
< review>
The entire process from finding a home to moving was a breeze. I was a little skeptical because the company is not local and all communication was via email but after speaking to Amira, I felt completely safe to move forward with the move in process. Sunday afternoon I drove around and looked at homes (self tour), found the perfect home....went back home and applied that same night. The next morning (before noon), I had an approval email from Tricon! From there it took no more than 72hrs to get everything finalized.
Fast forward to moving in....On the first day, I met with Michael, who did a walk-in inspection with me (first time experiencing this) and he ensured EVERYTHING worked probably and wrote down any issues that I saw (which was only a smell when the water was ran...that was fixed the follow calendar day)! The move in process took about an hour because he was very informative and made sure I understood how to submit maintenance requests in the future. The entire Tricon Team was awesome to work with. The only “Con” is that I’m currently having an issue with them withdrawing my first month payment and I’m being charged for something I believe I shouldn’t be charged for. Other than that, everything else is going amazingly! I couldn’t have asked for a better company to rent from! Oh, did I mentioned they rent out NEWLY BUILT Homes...such an amazing feeling to be the first one to live in a home and not worry too much about maintenance!!! Nice job on everything Tricon, I’ve been recommending you’ll and will continue to recommend you’ll to any and everyone.</review>

I did not know where to express my feelings on the company so I figured I would reach out here. Tricon American Homes has been a breathe of fresh air. Me and my wife love our home and our property manager Dustin has been great and responsive! My only complaint is the way they do their maintenance. If a problem occurs with the home they deal with outside companies with strict time schedules. Also a person must be home for the work to be done. So you will need to take off work, or have flexible scheduling. This I can live with, however, the maintenance supervisor Janet Oliver is very rude. I have requested a call with her before and she refused to take my call. I had an incident with my garage ceiling leaking, falling, and gushing water due to the shower running. After sending pictures to my property manager, I was told to contact the emergency line. An independent contractor came out and looked at the damage and scheduled a follow up. Great! I now have peace of mind with all things considered. <review>This is a review regarding my experience with Janet and Jonathan from Tricon (maintenance) on 12/16/19.

Recently, we had an appliance go out and once I submitted my work order, I received a call from Janet that she would have a technician out asap. Within an hour, Jonathan contacted me to let me know that he was on his way and wanted to make sure I was home. Once he arrived, he alerted me that I have cash laying out on the counter. I personally didn't think anything of it, but he wanted me to know that he saw it and would have taken a picture of it had I not been home. Jonathan communicated every step, respected my home by wearing booties, fixed our appliance, and cleaned up his work area. It was almost like he never came. :)

Once the work order was completed, he provided me with detailed instructions and let me know that if I needed anything else, to contact him. Janet made sure to follow up with me to make sure everything was handled professionally and correctly. I personally want to thank them both for handling this (dish washer) especially during a winter storm warning. It wasn't an emergency, but anyone who has ever had a dish washer malfunction and had to hand wash....it feels like an emergency. LOL.

Thanks again Tricon Team!

< Text>
Joke of a company. They only reply to people looking for a house. Once you sign your lease you better hope you can go a year without needing anyone who works for this company.
I've had hot water issues
Dripping faucet
Broken pipes
Dead garbage disposal
All these issues I've had to fix myself.

Also have had fees and charges tacked on to my rent.  My so called property manager refuses to respond to calls or emails. I get charged with an additional late fee because I emailed my manager 3 weeks before rent was due about the billing errors which she waits until after the rent deadline to get back to me. Coincidence? I dont think so.

Now I get an email stating this is my "FINAL WARNING" .. more like my only warning and now I'm gonna be charged for not having renters insurance. I bought a year policy when I first moved in. Now again she wont respond to me and according to her email I'll be charged an additional 25 dollars a month for insurance that only covers the home and nothing inside.

Again this company is a joke. Run! Find another property company especially if you are in Arizona. The Tricon group out here is a JOKE.< /Text>

<GmapID>0x80dcdeebf76d28e7:0xd40e54b6d26af133<//GmapID>< text>
After accepting a job in a different part of the state - selling my home of 20+ years and trying to navigate finding a rental home quickly that allowed multiple pets it was clear to me that Tricon American Homes was by far the easiest company to deal with when trying to find a decent multi pet friendly rental property. The home I have been in now for several years is by far the nicest of the pet friendly rentals that I looked at during my search. While I do believe for the price in rent they should provide more services, such as yard maintenance, annual inspections etc., I do realize that may be expecting too much!  This is a nationwide company and being as it is a large corporate, I do wish they would consider offering some sort of rent reductions for signing up for automatic rent payments and/or for multi-year tenants, instead of raising the rent every year on the people that do want to be in their homes, but again I do realize that this is not how things work, just throwing it out there!</text>

<GmapID>0x80dcdeebf76d28e7:0xd40e54b6d26af133<//GmapID><Text>Absolutely the worst firm I have ever worked with in terms of leasing. Then when you try to view or ask questions about the house, they will tell you "you should just sign." Tiffany Salyer is the portfolio manager over Texas and will not return any calls even though she is the sole decision maker on any lease extensions, etc. When I finally got a hold of her, she was dropping F bombs at what sounded like children while I was trying to tell her about my situation/problem. Absolutely an awful experience!< /Text><Response>{'time': 1589999531636, 'text': 'Richard, thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. At Tricon American Homes, we consistently apply the same responsible applicant screening criteria to all applicants in full compliance with all applicable state and federal fair housing requirements. To ensure a fair, consistent, and appropriately rigorous review in all cases, we retain a third party to review each applicant by consistently applying the same criteria. These reviews are comprehensive and include verification of employment, recorded evictions, and criminal convictions. Should your background check come back and is cleared, your application is approved pending verification of income you listed on your application. Upon submission of the rental application, you agreed to the Company’s Terms of Agreement as well as paid a non-refundable application fee per applicant and a $250 non-refundable holding deposit.  Our non-refundable holding deposit is in place as a formal expression of intent to acknowledge the prospective resident’s hold on a home while the application is processed. In order to continue the leasing process additional documentation was needed. In accordance with our Terms of Agreement, and in observance of Fair Housing, we universally apply the same standards to all our prospective residents, therefore the holding fee has not been returned. Thank you.'}</Response><user_id>115977066434275119661<//user_id><rate>1<//rate></record></dataset><record>

<Response>{'time': 1574719348931, 'text': 'Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us.  At Tricon American Homes, we consistently apply the same responsible applicant screening criteria to all applicants in full compliance with all applicable state and federal fair housing requirements. To ensure a fair, consistent and appropriately rigorous review in all cases, we retain a third party to review each applicant by consistently applying the same criteria. These reviews are comprehensive and include verification of employment, recorded evictions, and criminal convictions. Should your background check come back and is cleared, your application is approved pending verification of income you listed on your application. Upon submission of the rental application, you agreed to the Company’s Terms of Agreement as well as paid a non-refundable application fee per applicant and a $250 non-refundable holding deposit.  Our non-refundable holding deposit is in place as a formal expression of intent to acknowledge the prospective resident’s hold on a home while the application is processed. In accordance with our Terms of Agreement, and in observance of Fair Housing, we universally apply the same standards to all our prospective residents, therefore the holding fee has not been returned.  Thank you.'}<//Response>< Gmap_id>
0x80dcdeebf76d28e7:0xd40e54b6d26af133< /Gmap_id>
<Date>1574444044051<//Date>< text>
Make sure you want the place for sure before you even consider applying to one of their homes. They have a clause that states there is a $250 holding fee IN ADDITION to your application fees. They say if you are denied, you get refunded the fee. But if you are approved and choose not to move in, you are not refunded.

In our situation (4 roommates total), it was $50 for each app and then that holding fee. It wasn't even an hour (if that) after we applied that we seemed to have been auto accepted. BUT we had been applying to other places as well, and of course we decided to go with a better house that accepted us shortly after.

The thing I have a problem with is that they seemed to have AUTO accepted us. They didn't even have any proof of income from us or anything else of that nature. Guess why they did that? So they wouldn't have to give back that extra $250 if we decided to decline their approval. $250 goes a long way when you're as young as we are. Every penny counts, and that was a really shady way to do business. I don't mind losing application fees. Those are a given. But don't auto-approve people like that with NO proof of income or credit just to get your greedy paws on an extra $250. Bad business.</text>

<text>I rented from tricon for almost five years with no issues. I gave my notice to vacate right before the covid 19 drama started. I agreed, but upon logging on to the resident portal I found that I had a balance for the extra 8 days. I emailed Denise Bledsoe and she responded that I was responsible for the charges. I didn't ask for the extra 8 days so I called and emailed to no response. I received my security deposit balance in the mail and they charged me the almost $500 for the 8 days I didn't ask for!! In the middle of a pandemic!! Unprofessional and unsympathetic. Do not rent from them.

<Text>DON'T RENT FROM THEM.
Our neighbor is living in one of their properties. A few years ago, the neighbors called the company to have our mutual fence replaced. It's a 40 year old fence, that was being held together by a nail and a prayer. It took the company weeks to return a call, and finally send someone out. They propped up their sides with 1 board, and called it "fine".
Fast forward to a month ago. We decided to remove some ivy from the tree in our backyard, and some of it was attached to the fence. Needless to say, the whole fence started coming apart. Boards dropping, poles falling out of holes, etc.  We got ahold of the neighbor who gave us Tricon's information. So we and the neighbor who rents from them called them to let them know we needed to put up a new fence. Over a week went by, we tried emailing, and....nothing. The neighbor has a dog, and so we HAD to replace the fence asap. We found someone to do it, for a very reasonable price.
We have since contacted Tricon MULTIPLE times, and they are refusing to pay their half stating that its because they didn't use "their contractor"
We would have be fine using "their" person, but the company never got back to us to set up a time, and it had to be done.
I can't believe the lack of professionalism from this company.
If you are local, you are waaaaay better off renting from Solano Property Management.<//Text>< Pictures>

<time>1587049564832< /time><gmap_id>0x80dcdeebf76d28e7:0xd40e54b6d26af133<//gmap_id><user_name>Kylie Sprayberry<//user_name><Text>If I could give ZERO stars, I would!! I was originally told when I showed interest in one of their properties that they only process applications one at a time, so if I was interested in a property that someone already applied and paid the holding fee for, I would just be added to a waitlist, and if they were denied, the home would go back on the market and I would be able to apply and pay the holding fee. They said that if someone else has applied/paid the holding fee, IT WILL REMOVE THE HOME OFF THE MARKET AND THAT'S WHY I WOULD BE ADDED TO A WAITLIST. Keep that in mind....Well, I went to their website and looked up the home--still showed available, so I went through the entire application process. At the end it required me pay the $250 holding fee on top of the $50 app fees for both my husband and I, so I figured "Oh ok, no one has applied or paid the holding fee and been approved yet...it's still available, yay!". Literally within a matter of 20-30 minutes of them taking $350 from me, I received this email: Dear Kylie, We are pleased to announce that your application for (house I applied for) has been approved pending ID and income verification. Once our team successfully confirms your uploaded proof of identification and income, you will receive an official approval email with instructions on how to proceed through lease signing. We look forward to serving you as our resident. Sincerely, Tricon American Homes--All the email says that's "pending" is ID AND INCOME VERIFICATION. Other than that, they said we were APPROVED, and that they LOOK FORWARD TO SERVING US AS THEIR RESIDENT. That means we got the house don't you think??? Keep that in mind now. So fast forward to the next day, I can't remember at this point if they called me to inform me about the other applicant, or if I originally called them first to check the status of the pending ID and income verification, but regardless of who called who first, that's when I was informed of another applicant for the same home. I was told that they only had until the next day (you have only 48 hours after being approved to pay the security deposit and sign the lease, etc) to send in documentation and sign their lease, and if they didn't, the home was ours. This is where I started to get confused. If there was another applicant that was about to sign a freaking lease, WHY WAS I CHARGED ANYTHING, ESPECIALLY A HOLDING FEE?! If someone else applied and was that close to approval, that means THEY would've paid the holding fee, which should then have made the home UNAVAILABLE TO OTHER APPLICANTS! Am I right, or am I just crazy?? And on top of all that, WHY WOULD YOU SAY I'M APPROVED FOR A HOME WHEN YOU ALREADY HAVE ANOTHER APPLICANT AHEAD OF ME WAITING TO SIGN A LEASE?????? NONE of it makes sense to me. Well fast forward a couple of hours, and sure enough that other applicant came through and was approved and somehow my approval email was a lie? I was told THAT DAY (4/8/2020) that my holding fee was refunded. I have all of that in a text still. I was told that as far as when the refund would hit my bank account depended on the bank, so I figured maybe a day or two and I would have my refund back. Nope. Fast forward to Tuesday 4/14/2020, still no refund. I call my bank and ask how long refunds usually take. They said usually 3 business days. Well at this point it had been 4 business days. So I texted the rep at Tricon to find out if and when my refund was really sent. That's when I was told, "It wasn't until Thursday (4/9/2020) that they submitted according to the notes.) So instead of getting mad, I just said ok thank you and expected it to hit my bank the next day. Wrong again. It is now 4/16/2020, 6 business days (8 calendar days) since I was originally charged and told I was being refunded my money that I should've NEVER been charged to begin with, so I texted yet again to find out where it's at. I was told, "The refund has been requested in the full amount of $349.98 for your application number * just got all this emailed back this am."  REQUESTED?? WHERE'S MY DAMN MONEY?!?!</Text></record>

At Tricon American Homes, in order to treat everyone equitably and stay in compliance with Fair Housing and Equal Opportunity laws, we utilize a third-party credit rating agency. The agency objectively qualifies all applicants to rent our homes. Each applicant’s privacy and personal information is completely confidential.  As part of this confidentiality, we would never discuss contributing factors to our decision on such a public forum such as this.  However, as stated in our terms of agreement that was signed when submitting the application the items considered for rental qualifications include previous evictions, bankruptcy, landlord debts, utility delinquencies, FICO score, rent-to-income ratio, civil court history, level of collections, charge-offs length of rental history, and late payments. I just received keys on my move in date of March 25th in TX. The guy Robert was very nice and took notes of the issues & schedule repair ASAP. First impressions are important, and the house was not properly cleaned there was a leak and also a issue with the stoppers in both bathrooms. I was advised it will be fixed returned the next day and only the stoppers were repaired & new thermostat kitchen leak still present. l would like to move into a home that’s ready and repairs completed upon my move in date. I hope this is an oversight and not a common issue. I should’ve read the reviews before moving forward.......

Updated review
My repairs have been completed and hopefully no more to come now I can enjoy living here. The Dallas maintenance manager Jesse reached out to me personally and made sure to get the repairs completed in a timely manner. And I definitely appreciate it. Thank you.

Update December 30,2019
I have been trying to get a leak fixed for three weeks now! Two different companies came out and SAID the repairs were done, when the leak is still present. I had a appointment today and no one ever showed up or called to cancel. I’m sure my closet has mold due to the water leak and smell, Tricon call center is a joke they brush it off as no big deal! < text>
The house looked great online. It looked okay during the walk through, a dead bug here and there but not that bad. After we move in, roaches start coming out of the woodwork, which, after complaining they fix. The front and back doors had no weatherstripping weatherstripping and a/c was flying right out the door, no pun intended. For about 3 months, we keep finding wasps, some dead and some alive, between the windows and the blinds. We think they must be coming through the windows somehow. After the first 3 months, however, I go into the attic for something and hear a lot of buzzing. I find a MASSIVE wasps nest, spreading between the rafters. The nest has obviously been around for much longer than 3 months. I call the corporate office to get it fixed and they tell me I'm already beyond the first month where I can have them fix any pest problems and that I'll have to pay for it. After A LOT of arguing they reluctantly agree to pay for the pest control. Even the pest control guy said that nest had been up there for a very long time. Fast forward to the end of our lease, after numerous little fixes that took forever to get fixed.. I give notice to vacate at 30 days, unaware I had to give 60 days notice. They're making me pay another month because they automatically assumed that, after not hearing from me at the 60 mark, that I wanted to go month to month.. This was in my contract, which I did not notice, my fault. I was hoping for a little understanding, every single place I've lived required 30 days. Everyone I've talked to has never heard of such a thing, 60 days?? I was hoping for a little compassion, seeing as how this is the end of a lease and you can get seriously screwed if you have to pay for 2 leases, even if for just a month. I received neither. The manager just kept hiding behind the equal housing act and kept saying she couldn't cut me a break if she didn't cut others a break, we all have to be treated equally.. She was also very rude in the way she kept throwing "It was in your contract, it's not my fault you forgot" in my face. I had a 18 month lease, excuse me for not remembering..
If you're reading this wondering, should I rent a house from these people. The answer is simply "HELL NO". They don't care about you, only your money. I've worked customer service/sales my whole life. You can definitely tell they're giving you the kind of service you get when you're stuck somewhere, not the kind to win your business.<//text>

Hello,
I just wanted to share my experiences
I have been  dealing with Silver Bay for over a year until the change to Tricon. I have never had any issues with either company. They offer really nice, clean move in ready homes. Their prices are well within the market prices. From the beginning , I have almost exclusively dealt with Dawn Jones. I almost feel like she was and still is my personal contact with the company.  I can contact her for any reason, or question. She is very responsive to any request whether it be though e-mail, or phone contact.
When the company changed over to Tricon, there was no difference in anything at all. Everything remained the same with the exception of a new website. The payment options on the site are wonderful, and fast. Log in, pay your bill, log out. They have an online maintenance request feature as well which we have not had to use, but I''m confident that will be great as well. We may be looking to buy a home very soon, and I'm confident the company will help us. Thank you Dawn Jones, Silver Bay, and Tricon for giving my family a nice home to live in.<//Review>

< Review>
Been with Tricon for about 3 years here in Laveen (Phoenix Arizona ) 1st year was with SilverBay which Tricon bought out. So I had Tricon for 2 years technically. I can honestly say they are a good Management/REIT Company. They have never let me down in terms of communication, Maintainance and Repairs. Their properties are top notch as well. The inspection process is easy and smooth. They are always on TOP of their properties. Just to give you an idea, they have a superintendent do your move out. Everything is documented digitally and one of the benefits for new tenants moving in, is that they are actually making notes on the repairs etc needed to get the property back out to rent ASAP.  When my move out was completed, they were already in high gear to repair, paint, replace etc within minutes of completing my move out with them!

You can’t beat a company that’s on top of it like that! Literally within minutes of move out workers and contractors etc  begin working.

If you are planning to lease a tricon property trust me, they are the best when it comes to residential rental property.< /Review>

At Tricon American Homes, we consistently apply the same responsible applicant screening criteria to all applicants in full compliance with all applicable state and federal fair housing requirements. To ensure a fair, consistent and appropriately rigorous review in all cases, we retain a third party to review each applicant by consistently applying the same criteria. These reviews are comprehensive and include verification of employment, recorded evictions, and criminal convictions. Should your background check come back and is cleared, your application is approved pending verification of income you listed on your application. Upon submission of the rental application, you agreed to the Company’s Terms of Agreement as well as paid a non-refundable application fee per applicant and a $250 non-refundable holding deposit.  Our non-refundable holding deposit is in place as a formal expression of intent to acknowledge the prospective resident’s hold on a home while the application is processed. In accordance with our Terms of Agreement, and in observance of Fair Housing, we universally apply the same standards to all our prospective residents, therefore the holding fee has not been returned.  Thank you.'}< /Response>
