< text>
***UPDATE: Nick with the regional team in the Charlotte area reached out to us and was more than helpful. Unfortunately he was away on business when the issues with the a/c happened. If he had been in office, I feel we would have not had as much of a problem. He was more than helpful and apologized for the many issues. I thank Nick for his help and his exceptional customer service.

_______

Horrible customer service to go along with a horrible rental company. Host of issues since before moving in. Should have never rented with Tricon. We’ve been in this Tricon home (in the Charlotte area) for a little over a month and it’s been issue after issue.

Currently have been without a/c for six days. Tricon had a contractor come out last Wednesday to look at it. Contractor determined it needed parts ordered and said they’d contact us in 24-48 hours. After they didn’t, we contacted the contractor and asked them what the issue was — they informed us that Tricon wouldn’t let them order the parts needed to fix the unit, leaving us without a/c for going on a week now.

We were finally able to reach Tricon this morning and they are finally sending a new contractor today. They also said they’d have the contractor send temporary units but when I spoke to the contractor, they said the work order from Tricon said nothing about that. Just to add to it when I called the maintenance line to report the issue, the Tricon employee talked down to me like I knew nothing and that the a/c issue was basically my fault. It’s been absolutely ridiculous how they’ve handled this.

Other issues:
-Were by one Tricon employee that we could move in on a Saturday and then contacted by the Tricon move in inspection employee to set up our move on Monday or Friday and to be told that we couldn’t do Saturday, even though we had email documentation that we could. After unnecessary back and forth we were able to move in on Saturday.

-Upon moving in, we found the house dirty — garage filthy with dirt, cobwebs, leftover construction debris, etc.; downstairs with muddy footprints throughout; upstairs master bathroom and been used and not cleaned (disgusting); front porch covered in dirt; etc. Even after receiving the move in email that the house had been painted cleaned, etc. before our move, it most certainly was not cleaned and some areas not painted. Tricon offered us a $125 deduction off of next month’s rent but, to no surprise, we’ve yet to see that on our account.

-We had a couple of issues we needed addressed (back fence falling over in a couple of places, the interior garage door that hadn’t been painted and the front door that was broken and dented around the handle. They told us that they’d address the issues on the Monday after we moved in — they never called and after two weeks, we called the maintenance line to ask about getting the issues fixed, still they weren’t resolved and we then had to call again to get the issues fixed.

These are summaries of our issues. I emailed the Tricon executive email to address the issues. Of course they never responded, even after a follow up email about the a/c. Can’t wait to get away from this home and away from Tricon. Take my advice and DO NOT rent with them.< /text>

<name>T S</name>< Review>
Renting in Indiana has been very interesting compared to other states and Tricon Americans homes has made it a bit easier once we got ahold of a property manager.

We’ve lived in our home for three years and each year, they reviewed our lease to renew and each year our rent has gone up about $25-100 which is I guess reasonable comparatively.  We did have maintenance issues like normal homes do and Tricon has been pretty responsive once they receive your maintenance request.

Move out was very simple and I believe that’s because Deven Jeffries has made the process as painless as possible (outstanding service).  Our home was clean, there was normal wear and tare to the home and we got our full deposit back.  If this whole process is the same in the future, we would most likely rent with Tricon American Homes again.< /Review>

<name>Tim Reid<//name><time>1540365736077</time><rating>1</rating><review>Tricon does not value relationships. Check their properties on Zillow to find out how long their places stay on the market. They are losing money so to make up for that they are raising current tenants rents greatly.

< review>
We have had nothing but great service from Tricon!  The house is beautiful and in a great neighborhood.  It was updated before we moved in.  Due to no fault of their own, the AC had to be replaced and they worked very fast to work us in and get us up and running in the heat of the summer, even compensating us for the time we were out of the house.

When glue started coming through the floor seams, they had it cleaned up a few times.  When it continued to happen, they sent their head of maintenance out and then the owner of the flooring company.  Tricon replaced the entire downstairs floor with an even better quality floor.

The service persons have been nothing but polite and helpful.  The office has been in constant contact to check on things.  They even accidentally checked on the lease that the company would be doing landscaping when it was supposed to be the renter...they are going to honor the lease and make sure the lawn get mowed!

I would recommend them to anyone...this Indianapolis crew knows what they are doing and how to keep their tenants happy:)  Thanks Jessica, Nick and everyone whose names I'm forgetting!< /review>

<Name>Foma Okosi< /Name><Date>1565955787249<//Date>< rating>

< Review>
My experience with Tricon American Homes ended terribly. My family and I rented multiple homes with them for 4 years before we finalized on our home purchase in March 2019. We only stayed with them for convenience because they were a big company with lots of properties throughout GA to choose from and we decided to try different areas initially each year in order to conclude on where we want to purchase our home. The last home we rented from them, we ended up staying for 2 years. The company was just okay when it came to customer and providing maintenance support, until our last year, when we experienced how terrible they actual were. There was a leak in the home that lead to harmful and very active mildew and mold growth in our kitchen. It took them months before they finally resolved the leak, then even longer before they even attempted to take of the mold. Ultimately they never resolved the mold completely, the vendor they hired Trison Management was useless. We called, complained, submitted photos and literally got no where. It was absolutely astonishing.  We couldnt wait to close on our home and move out, because of the unsafe mold environment for ourselves and children. They did not care, the several people I spoke to were rude, and impersonal. They left us with no kitchen for almost 2 months in a failed attempt to remove the mold. The rude Tricon rep we spoke to, I think her name was Dawn, only offered a $60 credit towards our rent for the inconvenience. It would take me pages to breakdown the whole story. Finally when we were getting ready to move out the rude and impersonal Shanae Wiggins saw the pictures of the terrible mold and water damage throughout the kitchen and confirmed that we would not be liable at move out, that it was expected wear and tear. She didn't even care that we had to stay in such conditions. When we moved out they ended up still trying to keep our desposit and charge us for more money relating to the mold and water damage, that they NEVER RESOLVED. Eventually a reasonable person Anthony helped us in that area and got us back only part of our deposit. From everyone we corresponded on issues with, Anthony was the only one who showed patience and customer service.  Unless you want to deal with people that see you as just another tenant, only care about profits and lacks customer service, then I absolutely do not recommend this company.< /Review>

<resp>{'time': 1524003303610, 'text': 'Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. At Tricon American Homes, our purpose statement is "To go above and beyond, with our time, care and service, so that lives, and communities are enriched". It saddens me to hear that we failed to live up to our purpose statement in this case. Would you please provide me one final opportunity to resolve the issue causing frustration with us? If you would like to resolve your issue, please email me directly at TAHExecutive@TriconAH.com.\nAs you are aware at move-in, you signed a rental agreement, which states that rent must be received by the fifth of each month. Failure to meet this deadline results in a late fee and possible eviction if payment is not received. This protocol is followed closely to ensure we treat everyone equitably and stay in compliance with Fair Housing and Equal Opportunity law. We wish you and your family the very best.'}<//resp><GmapID>0x80dcdeebf76d28e7:0xd40e54b6d26af133</GmapID></record>

<Date>1564443444449< /Date><UserId.>115412093582780333864< /UserId.>< review>
I would give this company 1 star if it wasn't for Alainna going to bat for us. We applied for a home and a week goes by. The only contact we received was an email stating our application has been received and being review, someone should get back to us soon. We called Tricon and was told that no one picked up our application but looked at it now. We were approved, but the home we applied for was already taken. I asked if we could move our application to another house and I was told the $250  holding fee would be forfeit if we did that. I objected but proceeded with the application move anyway.

Two days go by, no contact. I called the office and was told by a very nice lady whose name escapes me that we were approved for the new home and they would not only refund the $250, but also the $90 in application fees. She asked me when we would like to move it and I told her Friday, July 12th, 2018.

I asked how to pay the rent and was advised to go to their Rent Cafe Portal, create the account and sign in. When I did, it showed an old address that I rented 2 years ago. I called Alainna and she advised me to send a money order to the office and where to send the proof of payment to while the money order is in transit. She stated not to pay on the portal since it shows the wrong address that way another company does not receive my payment. I didn't want to do it this way, but fair enough.

We then receive another call from Alainna the next day stating that everything is set and we can obtain the keys on Friday and someone would be in contact with us.

Friday comes, no call, no email, nothing. I called Tricon on my lunch and was told that he sees the request and a local rep would reach out to us. Again, no call. Here it is now 5 PM on Friday and we have no keys. I call Alainna who gets in touch with the property manager Fred, and he states our move in is scheduled for Monday, July 15th, not Friday.

However, we have emails and documents stating, "Move in date: Friday, July 12th, 2019." He stated he would get back with us. Approximately 2 hours go by, nothing. My wife calls him back and again says, "I was told your move in date was Monday, not Friday!" I then took over the phone call and advised Fred that we have movers coming tomorrow morning at 8 AM. I also stated I'm looking at an email stating "Move in date: FRIDAY, July 12th, 2019." I forwarded him the email and he apologized for the "lack of communication" and provided us the code to the box to get into the house.

We move in Saturday, life is great... or so we thought.

I then receive a call from Rachel (who goes by "Sofia") stating that they have not received payment from us and asked when they are going to receive it. I told her what Alainna advised us and she very rudely told me, "that's not the correct way, you needed to pay through the portal. You can't move in until we receive payment." I told her that I sent payment via certified mail, why I didn't pay on the portal and told her we already have the keys and moved in per Fred.

I logged into the portal to check how much is owed on Thursday, July 25th and it still showed the incorrect address. I did not have a chance to log in Friday to check. I log into the portal again on Sunday, July 28th and it showed the correct address and the incorrect amount. It stated we owed WAY more than we should.

I then checked the tracking on certified mail, still in transit. Tricon was supposed to receive the payment on July 15th. Sofia stated on the phone to me on July 15th, "as long as we receive payment today you're good." Okay, then why wasn't I contacted when payment wasn't received? Where was the communication with the tenant? Why did it take so long for my address to be corrected? If Sofia was so concerned about their payment, why wasn't I notified by her that payment was not received?

In short, Tricon has a complete LACK of internal communication. Alainna did everything in her power to keep us in our home. And with her professional assistance, we are staying!

There's more to this story but Google limits characters.</review>

< review>
I have updated my review after an email from Heather stating that some of my complaints were issues with Silver Bay Property Management, and took place before Tricon American Homes took over our lease.
Dealing with this company can be extremely frustrating.
When I called for maintenance because there was a bee hive inside our walls, I was told to spray it with a hose. Idiotic advice for sure. I had to push the issue, and kept stating over multiple phone calls the bees were INSIDE the wall. They finally sent out a technician to check, and he confirmed to them there were in fact bees inside our wall. He told them to send a professional. It should not take multiple phone calls, and two appointments to get something taken care of. I felt like they did not believe me when I made the request.
Dealing with the billing front office has been the most stressful experience. They have made our move out immensely trying. Alicia has caused the greatest amount of our frustration - and panic attacks. She was arguing with me about our move out date. It had already been set via email with Shelly. But, once again, I was not believed. Alicia interrupted me constantly, contradicted herself, and was just plain rude. I originally gave this company a 1-star review because of Alicia, but that is not fair to the people that are asctually really nice. Heather has been an immense help with getting everything taken care of. And, Juan (the technician helping with our move out inspection) has been so kind. They deserve 5-stars. So, that averages out to a 3-stars.< /review>

I have been given the run - around all week with the maintenance department.  All I need is a simple shower knob repair, and after sitting here all day waiting on someone to come to my home to repair the issue, I was told that the worker wasn't dispatched and they would have to schedule another appointment.  FOR WHAT!!!  THE FIRST PERSON WASN'T DISPATCHED RIGHT, SO HOW DO I KNOW THE NEXT APPOINTMENT WILL BE HONORED?!?!

I placed an online maintenance request on Saturday, July 15, 2017 requesting an appointment for Monday, July 17, 2017.  Supposedly, my request was never received, so I had to complete the request by phone.  I was promised that someone would call me with the appointment date and time, but I never heard from anyone.  I called again on Tuesday and was told the same thing.  I made another online request on Wednesday, July 19, 2017 and followed up with another phone call on Thursday, July 20, 2017.  I was told that a technician will be here today, July 21, 2017 between 8 and 11 AM.  By 11 AM, I had not heard from anyone, so I called the office...YET AGAIN...I was then told that the technician was not dispatched and that their earlier appointment would be....(I did not even listed to the available appointment because at this point, I am livid).

As I sat here to type this review, I hear a knock on the door.  Whose outside my door at 11:30 AM?  TRICON!!!  The technician said he was dispatched at 11 AM, which was about the time I was making the call to the company to determine when someone was coming, only to be LIED TO that the technician had not been dispatched.  I have never, in the three years of living in my home, had problems with the property management, maintenance, etc. until Tricon purchased my home.  I am so upset right now that I have tears in my eyes.  The maintenance department do not value people time or need.  I am a VERY unhappy tenant right now.

I pay my rent on time (before the due date) each month, and all I want is to make sure I get the service I deserve and need, the same service Tricon expect and deserve.  At the end of my lease, or whenever i decide that I am going to vacate the premises, I DO NOT WANT or NEED any discrepancies in the move - out inspection.  The manner in which I received the home is the manner in which I expect to return the home to the owner or property manager.  I don't know how anyone can bounce back from such poor customer service.

Amber, the maintenance coordinator, returned my call to offer another appointment, and I appreciate that, but the damage has been done.  I pray that I do not need any further maintenance needs before my lease ends because I feel like I will receive the same type of service as I have received this week, and this is absolutely unacceptable.< /Text>

I found a property and Tricon was very transparent with their process. However, after paying a $250 holding fee on the home, they said it was taken. They offered me a refund or to transfer to another home bc the system was not supposed to take my money since it was already rented. I opted for a refund and a few days later they told me it was a system error and I was approved for the home and can move in two weeks. The home is completely renovated and very affordable, in a safe neighborhood. I would have given 5 stars but unfortunately when they told me I wasn’t approved I put in an application with another apartment complex and my $300 deposit was non-refundable. That is not chump change and the rep at Tricon said they couldn’t do anything to accommodate me for my loss. I am going to move into the Tricon home bc it is the best fit for my family. I worked with Laetitia, the leasing agent at Tricon in Huntersville and she was more than accommodating and apologetic for the mishap. < user>

< user_name>
M King<//user_name>
<time>1533696220568<//time><Rate>4</Rate><Review>I have only recently moved into a property managed by Tricon American Homes and the entire process has been a wonderful, seamless experience. The staff has been very responsive and professional; and were attentive to my requests to help ease my transition from TN to TX. Two members of the team, Alan Todd and Alainna Oka, were especially helpful with my move-in and made sure I moved in successfully and understood the ins and outs of the property. Mr. Todd has also checked in to make sure everything was going well and reiterated contact information for persons to assist in resolving any issue should they arise.

I can't say enough about the team I have worked with (from application to move-in) and would like to thank each of them for making this move for my family one less stressful component of our move.

Update: Almost one year later and time to renew our lease. I really hope we don't regret it though. I'm only going to go down one star because we have enjoyed our experience here and past maintenance requests have previously been attended to fairly quick. Now we have a request for AC issues and in this heat it can get up between 85-90° inside the home. We are going on 2 weeks now and still nothing and this is the second time within 3 months of having the same issue. <Rating>1<//Rating><review>When you are looking for a home, they are prompt, but once you become a resident, they are slow to respond, or they don’t respond at all. My A/c went out, right before Labor Day. Mind you, it’s 90+ degrees in Atlanta, during the summer. At Tricon American Homes, our purpose statement is "To go above and beyond, with our time, care and service, so that lives and communities are enriched". It saddens me to hear that we failed to live up to our purpose statement in this case. Would you please provide me one final opportunity to resolve the issue causing frustration with TAH? If you would like to resolve your issue, please email me directly at TAHExecutive@TriconAH.com.  At Tricon American Homes, in order to treat everyone equitably and stay in compliance with Fair Housing and Equal Opportunity laws, we utilize a third-party credit rating agency. The agency objectively qualifies all applicants to rent our homes. Each applicant’s privacy and personal information is completely confidential. As part of this confidentiality, we would never discuss contributing factors to our decision on such a public forum such as this. However, the items considered for rental qualifications include previous evictions, bankruptcy, landlord debts, utility delinquencies, FICO score, rent-to-income ratio, civil court history, level of collections, length of rental history, and late payments. While you did not meet our rental criteria, we thank you for considering Tricon American Homes and wish you the best with your transition to Florida.'}<//Resp>

< Review>
I called for information on their pet policy today. The lady was polite, pleasant and had the information at the ready, however the 1 star comes from the policy itself. They still charge the pet fee even if it is just a caged animal. So if you have a hamster that cost 10 bucks, prepare to shell out 300 dollars regardless. That is just absurd and most other "pet friendly" companies I have talked to will waive the fee or at least reduce the fee significantly. I was told that I would be charged 500 total for 2 small caged animals. That is why I will not be doing business with them as that is just ridiculous. At least I was given the information promptly so that I'm not wasting my time on their website.

Edit: In reply to the owner below.

I read the form on your website prior to calling. It didn't specify a specific rule on caged animals so I called for clarification. Often times, companies are iffy on exoctic animals. The pets we are talking about are 2 ferrets. They are primarily caged, but some places make a special rule about them. Hence my call.< /Review>

I moved into a Tricon American Home on February 1st 2019. In Dallas Georgia. I have had issues since I moved in. I didn’t have a dishwasher for three weeks. There was rat feces coming from the Attic!
Now let’s get to the icing on the cake. I received a 330 dollar water bill. My husband I have never paid more than 45. We aren’t here for 12 hours a day. We have us and a dog. We were told we used 6, 730 gallons in February. That is wasteful. My friends who have pools use less than that.

I hope they can explain the high bill and the issues.  The plumber that came today, he was awesome. However it is intresting that a house you bought in November has so many issues.

My neighborhood was changing to a private company to read the meter. So when the city of Dallas sent me a refunded check I received 117 dollars. I spoke to All in one the property management company that says they sent mailers to tricon telling them about the water changes. There is no reason they shouldn’t have known.  I got ripped off because no one could tell me how to switch the water to my name. It is not my fault that no one knows how the transition should take place.
Now the new company is charging another 150 dollar deposit that is actually to cover the HOA. Even though in the lease it mentions HOA being covered by tricon. Coverage should include deposits and fees.  I’m sure they will rob me of more money.

However you should be held accountable for the big things they tell you that change.

<UserId.>104108698846786392508<//UserId.><user_name>Michael Chopcinski<//user_name><date>1547092967301< /date><rate>3</rate>< text>
Update:
I received a call from a senior manager that explained to me that they are sorry that I was in a home that had several issues. They are refunding me my security deposit with is awesome as  I have purchased a home and will use my deposit towards my new home.

I would stay far away from renting properties from Tricon American Homes. They have too many properties to deal with and will not make your issues seem like they are important, ever.

I first moved into a property in the Houston area and when I moved into the place it was barely cleaned but I had to take the keys as I was coming in from out of town and wasn’t going to spend more money on a hotel. It was obvious that Tricon didn’t do an actual pre-inspection of this property. I discovered broken cabinet drawer in kitchen, chewed up blinds, overgrown bushes that should have been removed (blocking view of driveway), the steel rod at end of the driveway curb was completely exposed,  and all three of the sinks had caved in cabinets under them. The stove was hard wired into the wall so the clock worked but the stove did not. It took them 8 days to get it fixed after I discovered it the day after I got my keys. The day after I got my keys, I also realized I had no hot water and that required major repairs to the hot water tank that took 5 days for them to get to. Two weeks after moving in I came home to water coming thru the ceiling in my kitchen. Took them 4 days to get someone out with the diagnosis being the new AC was installed without a drip pan to drain. That took 8 total days to get fixed. Fast forward a few months later and I go out of state to get married and move my new bride to Texas into the rental property. We walk into the house after me being gone for 5 days and I have major water leaking thru the celling in the dinning room. While I was gone the pipes in the bathroom broke. It took them 3 days to get someone out to look at it and a total of 9 days till the celling and toilets were fixed. The water leaking ruined about $600 worth of kitchen appliances that were sitting on a metal shelving. The leak also cost me another $300 in that months water bill.

With all of this my new bride and I decided to break our lease and look into buying a home before we had any other issues. Tricon did not give me any leeway with the two month lease breaking penalty indicating the issues I had in the rental home were mostly things that come up with normal rental homes. The exact wording from an Assistant Portfolio Manager was:

It appears that although you’ve had maintenance issues,  all were resolved. They’re going to be repairs needed, which is just the nature of renting a house. We’re sorry for any inconvenience and we are here to help when issues arise or for any questions you might have.

That is actually absurd as very few homes ever had two major water leaks in a 6 month time frame not to mention all the other issues I had with renting from them.

And before management contacts me saying we are so sorry that you had these issues and how can we resolve this someway, the only way at this point is to actually give me my deposit back as I had to use it to cover half of the early lease breaking penalty.< /text>

< review>
We put in a maintenance request 4 months ago for our leaking roof (two spots). Someone came out and put a tarp on it and we have not heard any kind of FIX or solution - other than the roofers, while putting the tarp on, telling us they cant believe the roof is still attached because it is so old. Now, we have leaks in FOUR spots. I called before hurricane Irma hit us to ask for some kind of reinforcement and was told there was nothing they could do. Really???? A hurricane was coming and I was told to deal with it. Having me and my family endure a hurricane with a compromised roof DIRECTLY put our lives in danger. I tried to call the day after and was told I would be called back that day - did that happen? Of course it didn't! I have tried to call 3 times today and am currently on hold, once again. Not sure what it is going to take to get our roof fixed... Maybe call code enforcement? Fill out a hold of rent form with our lawyer? Its a shame that Tricon cares so little about residents that I have to go through all of this to get a hold of anyone to get answers, not to mention, literally endure hurricane force winds when we know our roof is so fragile (and leaking). This has been a nightmare for my whole family - especially my daughter.

I have tried every means of contact - maintenance requests, calling, email, FB message...

This is NOT the product we signed to rent. The product we signed up to rent is a safe home. Not one with a 30 year old roof and a tarp - not to mention, the decorative and attractive water stains we have on the inside of our home :/

I am not a complainer and can usually find positivity and understanding in almost every situation - but I think I have given Tricon more than enough time to rectify this and have grown exhausted with making up excuses for a company who makes it clear they do not care.<//review>

My hardwood floors are coming up and those have not been fixed. The paint was chipped off of my cabinets, I am missing shingles, some appliances were messed up, my sprinkler head is broken. Somethings did get fixed AFTER I had to continuously bring it to their attention. Currently, my shingles are not fixed, nor are my floors. I also had to make another  deposit for my lights because they told the lighting company to switch the lights to their name and out of mine. I’ve been missing work so I could get caught up with the house since Tricon did not do wphat they were suppose to do, and I should not have to miss work to makeup for their mistakes. < Review>
If you have an appointment with Maritza Llanos, do not waste your time -she won't show up.
Set an appointment over the phone with a very nice man for a home for rent. Unfortunately the agent only accepted appointments from 11am to 3pm which seemed like a pretty small window to me considering it is a huge part of an agent's job. But my boyfriend and I took off work anyways to make the 3 pm appointment.
After waiting over an hour the agent,  Maritza Llanos, never showed up. I called and asked what was up and they told me they couldn't get ahold of her but that they would try and get me the lockbox code so I could view the property. Waited another half hour and still nothing. I called again and they said the house had been rented by the time I was sitting there waiting.
Are you serious? Is this even a legit business? My boyfriend and I took work off to see this house and the agent doesn't even have the courtesy to call and apologize for not being able to make it? Doesn't tell us the place has been rented just makes us lose money that we could be making at work to wait around for two hours.
Funny thing is, I thought the main business line was pretty friendly so I scheduled another appointment for another place. But again, the same agent,  Maritza Llanos. I called an hour before to make sure she'd be there this time and they tell me I shouldn't even go to the appointment because she hasn't been calling anyone back. How is Tricon even renting these places out if no one can see them and no one can get a hold of the only agent that can? I don't like telling people how to do their jobs but you would think there would be some effort to actually do them.
Honestly I wouldn't recommend Tricon to anyone that wants to keep their sanity. The call center was incredibly friendly but they really need to fire  Maritza Llanos if she's not going to do her job.<//Review>

The home had been on the market for QUITE SOME TIME.. even a 1st month's free rent (which was MAGICALLY taken off when we submitted an application..go figure). Then I brought up the fact it'd been on the market for so long, the flooding question being sugarcoated, and the fact that it was posted for 1st months free rent, I got a cancellation email saying my lease to be signed has been voided. < Name>
Richard Barnette<//Name>
<Time>1522709198229< /Time>< Review>
I'm 6 months in to my first lease with Tricon.  Shortly after I moved in I identified a drain leak and drain fly infestation, the plumber Tricon sent out recommended moisture remediation and a lime treatment for the crawl space that still has not been completed.  A month or two later my HVAC system shut down due to a carbon monoxide safety feature, the contractor reported a rusted heat exchanger that required replacing the entire unit.  Noted an odor in the attic and reported it, contractors in hazmat suits went in and ventilated the attic over a weekend while I was in the house.  They indicated that repairs were needed to prevent recurrence, those have not been acted on.  Tricon doesn't answer phone calls or respond to voice mail.  Contractors have hauled two trailer loads of debris from the yard since I moved in, the photos show the debris piles that remain and the areas of the yard that have not been touched.  I don't know if this is a typical Tricon experience or if the property I am renting has slipped between the cracks.  So far I have been exposed to carbon monoxide and mold particles and can't get Tricon to detail my exposure for risk assessment.  If you are considering renting a home from Tricon please take my experience into account.  Good luck!

Update.  Tricon has been responsive since this post, an additional 8 trailer loads of debris have been removed from my backyard, I would estimate that we are about 80% of the way to acceptable.  The HVAC system has been replaced and they installed a carbon monoxide detector.  I am being called weekly to report status and appreciate the effort to make this right.  The folks I have dealt with seem to be genuinely interested in fixing this, I think they have added so many homes at such a rapid pace that staff is overwhelmed.< /Review>

I was advised the home would be available July 23, 2018. At that time I was 34 weeks pregnant. So the lady Gloria Perez  that worked with me asked me to view the home on July 11th. I get there and she does not have a key so we can view the home. She made promises for the upcoming weekend with me to view the home.  I called and text her about the weekend and on Saturday but she never responded. So I went online to look company up. I advised her I wanted to move in asap because she could see I was very pregnant. Come July 18th I still have not viewed the home but did go ahead and put in a application on the property because I did not want to miss out on the home. School is close to starting and I only want to focus on the baby coming. July 19th I got a welcome letter from Erin Butler with Tricon saying I can move in on July 23 2018. On July 20th the baby did not want to wait and I delivered my baby boy. I called Tricon a few times and finally a young lady emailed Erin to give them an update since I needed to send signatures on a few forms in two days. I asked for three days since I was at the hospital. After I spoke with her I got another email on July 20 from Erin Butler again asking me to sign forms. I signed the forms but upon reading the paperwork, it stated my move in date was 8/15/18 not 7/23/18. It took 5 days before my son got a response from Erin not me. I wanted a call but instead my son got an email saying yes move in not until 8/15/18. This was acceptable. I told Tricon I chose their home over the others I looked at soley on their home being available in July. I asked why would they change the contract and not call me. If I did not read the contract on my own I would have been left in the dark about the whole thing. Erin only said you can pick another home or we can give you your application fee back $90. I said please find me a home in the same area because I needed the children to be in same district and schools that I applied for. He finds a smaller home 30 minutes away in a different district.  This whole time I am calling Iam living in a hotel with my teenagers and my newborn. I asked them to please send forms to the same email you responded to when i asked for days for a call back on why the dates where changed but you emailed my son the response instead. I made a change to his email address and it should have been on file.Then my son is informed that Tricon needed to reach out to their IT dept because for some reason they could not get the email to go through. By this time it is Aug 2, 2018.  Later that same day I get emails from Tricon admin dept stating they have cancelled our application for the home since my son did not sign forms. He is 19yrs old. He is only on paperwork because he is over 18 years old. I am the one paying the bill. So I am homeless and still at the hotel that i have already been at for 2 weeks and spent over $700 dollars on. I have never dealt with a company this disorganized and unprofessional. They did not care I was spending all this extra money because of them and their lack of communication. I have not had a chance to really enjoy motherhood with my newborn because of all of this and to just cancel my application again no call just emails is how I was being communcated with it is ridiculous. I hate I even reached out to them and I definitely will never refer anyone to them ever. I replied to admins emails saying I wanted my application fee back and of course I have not got a response which does not surprise me at all.

Disappointed Customer,

< review>
A couple months ago we were given a sudden notice to leave our home that we've been staying in for so many years.  It was a very stressful situation, but Tricon Homes made this whole moving process a lot easier than we had imagined.  We were mostly working with Maritza, who I must say was AWESOME from beginning to the end. She was very sweet, quick to answer all questions and concerns I had (even though for a second I was probably being annoying with all the questions I kept asking her), and she went above and beyond making sure everything was all set for us before we moved in.

Upon moving in, we noticed some things that needed to be repaired and Maritza made sure someone reached out to us immediately.  We have been in the home since July, and we couldn't be happier with the decision we made on moving here.  I would highly recommend Tricon to anyone, and if you're working with Maritza you're definitely in great hands =))

PS- They offer the convenience of being able to pay your rent online, which a lot of places still does not do (Hello, it's 2017!!) The thought of not having to pay with a money order or check like the old-fashion way is GREATTTT!!  It's one less thing I have to worry about every month... =)</review>

The lease was expensive, rent higher than average, and they will nickle and dime your deposit so don't plan on getting any of it back.

Started out the first week in the house unaware the house was rigged for natural gas. So didn't have hot water or a stove for 2 weeks.

House was full of german cockroaches from the start, very difficult to exterminate. Kitchen was built poorly and allowed roaches to fester in every crevice.

Maintenance requests were resolved incredibly slow and inefficiently. One time a guy came to fix the dishwasher and refused to put it back together because he wasn't familiar with the model.

Backyard fence was shotty and the yard had no grass, even though I was reminded frequently that upkeep was tenant responsibility.

On numerous occasions the management was contacted and a reply didn't solve the problem but just cited a generic rule or policy, very impersonal and rude at times.

Would look elsewhere for property management or deal privately. Tricon American Homes has poor customer service and is only looking out for their bottom line at all times. Avoid!!!< /Text>< pics>

However when I finally got a hold of someone the last time i was told that there was an application already turned in thats why i couldnt go pass step one. Silver Bay reminded you of your upcoming lease expiration by a mailed letter prior to Tricon American Homes becoming your property manager in mid-May 2017. Once your lease expired, you became a month-to-month resident which incurs a premium of $150/month. However, per your conversation with the regional management team, as of July 1, 2017 you have resigned a long-term lease with us and the extra charge was removed from your account.  2) Lawn Maintenance - Silver Bay’s standard practice was to review this policy with all residents at the time of move-in. Communication notes from Silver Bay also state that they reminded you of lawn maintenance policy via email and mailed letter. The exact verbiage can be found under section 12 of your signed lease and states that the resident is responsible to maintain the quality of the lawn during their residency. 2) Fences - It is standard practice for Tricon American Homes to installs fences around rental homes if there are liability issues (pool, river, etc.). We hope this information is useful and addresses all your concerns. Should you have any additional questions, please feel free to contact us at (844) 203-8531. Thank you.'}< /response>

In fact they have again sent me another 30 day notice and mind you the fence still hasn't even been properly fixed.
Looking at some recent reviews it seems like I am not the only one having these kinds of issues. I also noticed a lot of responses on all the wonderful reviews. Too bad they don't pay as much attention to their customers needs as they do their reviews....

New update!! I was contacted by the senior portfolio manager for our area. After consideration for the best possible outcome I agreed to a settlement with Tricon. While I feel that they are not outright accepting responsibility I do feel that they have made an effort to correct the situation. With rapid expansion there will always be something that slips through the cracks. I am hoping that this will be an eye opener for them and that the necessary changes will be made. I would also like to personally thank Heather and Marlena for being able to change my opinion of this company. Their time and effort have been truly appreciated. While I can't give them a 5 star rating just yet I would definitely consider them in the future.

Update!! I guess this is how they handle their problem tenants. We received a 60 day notice today to vacate. Signed by the same Claudia Moya who lied in an email that she sent to me saying that this was the first time she had heard about the fence being an ongoing problem even though she was responding to an email from a month previous where she acknowledged the problem.

Unfortunately it has come to making publicly known the amount of drama we have had to endure at the hands of this company. We have been in our current residence for going on 4 years. Our fenice which was not properly installed had deteriorated over the years. We had tried to advise them on several occasions what needed to be done. They however have chosen to patch work the job to the tune of probably close to a dozen visits by 4 different companies. This past winter we were without protection from the coyotes that roam the desert behind our house or the neighbors dog who eventually got in our yard and attacked our dog in front of my 10year old son. Now last year when the option to renew our lease came about that along with our change in financial situation became a huge concern. We had been consistently late and getting hit with 5 day notices to pay or quit by the 6th of each month. They refused to make a payment arrangement and said it was company policy to refer it to an attorney. I explained that our situation had changed and addressed the fact that we would be consistently 5 business days after the 1st and asked if we would be able to have a grace period or if we should move then. We were assured that the fence would be fixed and that the 5 days would not be a problem but they could not put that in our lease. With my experience I should have known better. Of course the first month that we paid late we received a 5 day notice to pay or quit. I've lost count of how many over the years. In all my years of collection experience and Property Management I have never heard of a company not accepting a payment arrangement. I thought that's why they had late fees? We have not been perfect renters but we have tried. We have never broken a promise to them or not taken care of our home. In any case my advice would be to not rent a property if you see the title tricon American Homes attached to it.< /Text>

< Review>
Stay away. Waste of time. I pre qualified with a credit score well over the minimum requirements. My income is over double the minimum requirements. No evictions. No criminal history. Yet, got denied? Their screening system is obviously flawed. They treat you like a number, not an individual. Have never had a problem anywhere with getting approved to rent. Got approval for another place in less than a day after the stole my 45 dollar application fee. Honestly, I believe the whole pre qualify thing is a scam. I would almost bet a big chunk of their revenue comes from telling people the pre qualify and then take ther $45 application fee. <Response>{'time': 1494614238835, 'text': 'Chris, we are sorry that you were unable to rent with Tricon American Homes.  At this time, we offer a prequalification option in the Las Vegas market only.  The primary objective of our prequalification service is to identify severely adverse items in an effort to prequalify all those interested in our rental homes without hurting their credit. Without sharing too many details of your confidential information through an open source, you were indeed prequalified based upon not having certain adverse items during the prequalification stage.  Some of the items considered during prequalification are previous evictions, landlord debts, utility delinquencies, FICO Scores and rent to income ratios. However, prequalification is not our final applicant screening. Our final rental applicant screening process is a comprehensive review into an applicant’s background including civil court history, level of collections, length of rental history and late payments. <rate>1<//rate><Review>This company is a complete joke! From the lengthy maintenance processes, to the lack of communication and un professionalism. The icing on the cake was today, when my door bell starts ringing at 9:08 am which is the 17th of August, ( I already have a confirmed appt for the 19th). I go to the door and 6 ppl are standing there saying that they are with tricon American homes. After a brief back and forth about the mix up on their part, they proceed to enter my home and take photos of MY belonging. One of the ladies asked about the hvac system and appliances which can be accessed from outside (hvac) and all appliances are down stairs. It started to make me irritated when they started to proceed upstairs and sneakily take photos of my bedroom. There was an actual confrontation between the staff when I told them that my son was asleep in a room and one of them still insisted that they go in and one of them didn't agree. They still opened the door to sneakily take a quick photo inside. Like I said I have been a resident for 2 years now. Not by choice. but I know for sure what happened here today was a violation of my privacy and some plain old B.S... <review>The maintenence side of Tricon is terrible, at least for my property. It took them 6 months of me calling to have them install rain gutters, which they agreed should have already been on.
A leaking pipe in my attic was fixed by a guy that does small pressure washing jobs and asked to borrow a pipe wrench.
It took almost a month to fix a leak in my living room that sat for days before the carpet was replaced with a random new color. I kept calling and emailing them my concern about mold, but they kept brushing it off saying it isn't mold, or just denying the contractors request to test for it.
I requested someone look at the house to see my concerns I've been noticing. They sent a contractor out who wrote it all down and took pictures, saying he will take care of everything. After 2 weeks with no contact from anyone, I had to call Tricon. They didn't know if the order was assigned to anyone, or if anyone had even come out to the house yet. The next day I was called by a new contractor who repeated the same process with no contact after 2 weeks. The 3rd time, they sent the Tricon superintendent. He tells me they can't or won't spend the money to fix most of my concerns.  My master closet is so humid, one of those damp rid bags hanging fills up completely in about 7-9 days.  He said the gap under the door was correct and they wouldn't spend the money to add a small AC vent for airflow.  He suggested putting a fan in front of the open closet door. He said the moisture could be from the AC pick up vent being dirty, and that we should change the filter out each month. Then he said they actually recommend using the cheaper air filters, and not to buy the better ones because the cheaper ones allow more airflow, which in turn would actually help cool the house faster. We have a dog so we change the filter out almost twice a month with quality filters. The day after he came out, I decided to take down all of the air vents because there was green mold on them, which the guy also attributed slightly to the filter thing.  The inside of every vent in the house had large amounts of green and white mold growing.  I sent him the pictures and he assured me the contractor coming to fix the other things specializes in "discoloration" and that he would take care of all "discoloration" and make sure there are no other signs of "discoloration" and that there were no other safety issues.  He pushed the word "discoloration" a lot.  I've found Tricon will do it's best to not acknowledge the word mold.  It's been 11 days since I received the response about the mold, and I still haven't heard anything from anyone.  I complained about all of these issues to the person that sent me my lease renewal last month, and she said she would notify someone of my concerns and touch base with me the next day.  I never heard back from her either.  I haven't been able to get in touch with any type of management.  My maintenence coordinator, Yolanda Zamzam, has been impossible to contact from the beginning.  She doesn't answer her direct number, other staff on the phone can't reach her, and I have specifically requested that she contact me just to let me know what's going on over 10 times.  Not once has she contacted me.  She emailed me once to say my work order has been assigned.  I replied and let her know how frustrating it's been not knowing what's going on, and having random contractors call me to come look at what 3 other people already have. I told her that I'm not on my email a lot and it would be much better if she could call me directly next time.  I received an email a few days later saying someone will contact me to come look at my problems. I've also stop taking off time from work for their appointments, because the first 3 days I did that, no one showed up, or they arrived around 3pm instead of 8am as promised.</review>< rating>

<time>1499296133879<//time><rating>1< /rating><Review>It has been an ABSOLUTE NIGHTMARE since Tricon took over Silverbay. The maintenance response has been UTTERLY EMBARRASSING. In June, our A/C went out in the middle of the day on a Saturday. I immediately called and made a maintenance request. I was told they would contact a vendor and someone would be out as soon as possible. Several hours later, Tricon called back and said they couldn't find someone to come out because they couldn't find a vendor that services my area, but someone would definitely be to the house on Sunday. I ended up having to put my large family in a hotel room for the night. Sunday came and went. I talked to Tricon multiple times and all they ever said was that they could not find a vendor that services my area. My family again had to stay in a hotel room. Tricon said someone would definitely be out to the house on Monday. Monday afternoon came and Tricon still had not found a vendor. After multiple phone calls and raising enough fuss, I finally got to speak to someone in my "local" Tricon office. Tracy Downing (portfolio manager) assured me that someone would be out. I finally got tired of waiting and my family needed to be able to go back home. So I called my own repair guy. He was there within 2 hours. And he had the problem fixed in under an hour.
I called Tricon and explained that it cost a lot of money to put my family in a hotel room and I had to pay out of pocket for the A/C repair. Tracy Downing emailed me and me to send her my hotel bill and repair bill and she would submit it for approval for reimbursement. After another week of calling and emailing with no response, she finally responded that Tricon would reimburse me for the repair, but only $90 a day for the hotel! Tricon expects a large family to be able to stay in a hotel for only $90 a day?! I explained to her that she never mentioned a limit for reimbursement and that this was unacceptable. She told me she would get in touch with her boss. It's been several days since I've heard from her now. Its ridiculous that this company expects a family to pay out of pocket to stay at a hotel for more than $90 a day.
Last week, we went through the same type of issue with a busted water pipe in the front yard. It burst in the middle of the day on a week day. We immediately reported it, but Tricon claimed they couldn't find a vendor that services my area. It took them a day and a half to get someone to come repair it.
How are you a national rental company, but you can't find vendors that service areas where you own property?
Lately, I have tried to call two different people in my local Tricon office: Tracy Downing and Abby Boorstin. Neither one of them ever answer their phone or return phone calls. This is pathetic customer service. I will not be renewing my lease at the end of this term and if I could find a way to get out of the lease I have now without paying an absurdly high penalty, I would.<//Review><pictures>None<//pictures>< resp>

<Resp>{'time': 1520271445747, 'text': 'Mr. Williams, thank you for taking the time to share about your experience with us.  At Tricon American Homes, we consistently apply the same responsible applicant screening criteria to all applicants in full compliance with all applicable state and federal fair housing requirements. To ensure a fair, consistent and appropriately rigorous review in all cases, we retain a third party to review each applicant by consistently applying the same criteria. These reviews are comprehensive and include verification of employment, recorded evictions, criminal convictions and combined gross income of all applicants. While you did not meet our rental criteria, we thank you for considering Tricon American Homes for your rental home needs. We would also like to invite you to call us at (844) 203-853 should you have any questions. Best of luck to you in finding your new home.'}<//Resp>< pics>
None<//pics>
